1. Sorry for late response. Investigation the problem took some time.

2. It's working like a charm!!!!

3. I do not know why it didn't work at first try. Or second or third reinstallation.

4. But when erasing all keys with "DVDFAB" in registry, reboot and reinstall - it workd and it still does.

5. So sorry for taking your time with local trobles

6. Best wishes to all

Thanks so much for this, I've been going nuts for a few days after losing a whole bunch of programs due to a hard drive crash, this one being one of them. I've tried many DVD cloning/ripping apps over the last few years and this is, by far, the best of the bunch and it keeps getting better with every iteration. 

Thanks again!
Np w/this one, W7 Pro-64, thanks Thumper.

"dvd xxxxx has expired" [replace xxxxx with "Clone" or "Copy" etc. is displayed even after the crack is copied to the program folder. I am guessing the existing crack that has been around has been "fixed" by DVDFab?

Did'ja remember to uncheck the "check for new version" function under General Settings?

If this isn't disabled, the software will expire various options once it connects with its web server.

Great job bro... replaced a previous slightly broken version from someone else. Just search for and delete your registry folders for DVDFab if you had it previously installed. Then follow Thumpers directions. Should work fine. Remember to go into the general settings tab and disable the "auto check for updates" too. Running Win7 Ultimate x64... Thanks again man!
